org.jooby

Interface Renderer.Context

  • Enclosing interface:
    Renderer 

    public static interface Renderer.Context
    Contains a few utility methods for doing the actual rendering and writing.
    Since:
    0.6.0
    Author:
    edgar

    • Method Summary

      • send

        void send(byte[] bytes)
   throws Exception
        Write bytes into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if none was set It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.octetstream if none was set.
        Parameters:
        bytes - A bytes to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(ByteBuffer buffer)
   throws Exception
        Write byte buffer into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if none was set. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.octetstream if none was set.
        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(String text)
   throws Exception
        Write text into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if none was set. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.html if none was set.
        Parameters:
        text - A text to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(InputStream stream)
   throws Exception
        Write bytes into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if the response size is less than the server.ResponseBufferSize (default is: 16k). If the response is larger than the buffer size, it will set a Transfer-Encoding: chunked header. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.octetstream if none was set. This method will check if the given input stream has a FileChannel and redirect to file
        Parameters:
        stream - Bytes to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(CharBuffer buffer)
   throws Exception
        Write text into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if none was set. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.html if none was set.
        Parameters:
        buffer - A text to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(Reader reader)
   throws Exception
        Write text into the HTTP response body. It will set a Content-Length if the response size is less than the server.ResponseBufferSize (default is: 16k). If the response is larger than the buffer size, it will set a Transfer-Encoding: chunked header. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.html if none was set.
        Parameters:
        reader - Text to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.

      • send

        void send(FileChannel file)
   throws Exception
        Write file into the HTTP response body, using OS zero-copy transfer (if possible). It will set a Content-Length if none was set. It will set a Content-Type to MediaType.html if none was set.
        Parameters:
        file - A text to write.
        Throws:
        Exception - When the operation fails.
